intro: Pimpinella magna subsp. rubra, commonly known as the red-hairy cow-wheat, is a member of the Apiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive reddish stems and leaves. It is native to parts of Europe and western Asia, where it thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Its leaves are palmately lobed and often covered in fine, reddish hairs, giving it a unique appearance. The subspecies is noted for its medicinal properties, with some traditional uses in herbal remedies.
